data.title: Atlassian Corporation Q4 2025 Earnings Call Aug 07, 2025
data.overview: Management highlighted strong FY '25 execution with over $5.2 billion in revenue and over $1.4 billion in free cash flow, continued Rule of 40 plus performance, and pronounced enterprise momentum evidenced by a record number of deals greater than $1 million in ACV in the quarter (up over 2x year-on-year) and a cloud net revenue retention rate of 120%. AI adoption was emphasized as a key growth driver—"We reached 2.3 million AI now, up 50% from last quarter"—and the newly launched Team '25/Teamwork Collection is exceeding expectations, driving consolidation onto Atlassian Cloud; management also announced a strategic Google Cloud partnership to accelerate cloud transformation and AI delivery. Leadership noted strong cross-product revenue growth (Jira, Confluence, Jira Service Management, Loom), large-customer migrations momentum, continued hiring and investment to pursue the company’s three transformations (Enterprise, AI, System of Work), and disclosed a planned President transition at year-end.
